page.title: 13ABERDEEN: LIBRARIES.
page.content:
ABERDEEN: BRANCH LIBRARIES.
The library service in Aberdeen is generally very good although many people on the larger estates feel they are not well served. People on the the largest estate - Tillydrone - have to go to either Woodend or Linksfield Libraries; both involve a journey by bus. Local people are also worried by the possibility that some branch libraries may be closed by the Council in an effort to save money.
Our libraries are open six days a week, usually from 9am until 8pm. One library, situated in the Old Town House is open only in the afternoons and Saturday morning.
